definition: full of intense interest or excitement : eager
examples: "… That was the year the Twilight movie was going to come out, and the kids were agog with all things vampire. …"
"… There goes Mrs. Tony now, all agog to spread such a delectable bit of gossip."
His talent [as a painter] is so enormous that you look at his surfaces with your mouth agog at the near-impossibility of it all.

definition: full of wonder or surprise : astonished
examples: Jones … fired a strike to a waiting receiver that left his coaches agog.
In the evenings … the streets … were agog with life.
His lyrics are agog with images that manage to be poetic and earthy at the same time …

definition: in an excited or astonished manner
examples: … he posed for photographs with rugby fans of all ages, before playing with the 39 youths who were staring agog at their idol.
